posts.postText: I have been noticing that recently, the Jail server will display that it is full and not let you join it, even though the ammount of players is far below the cap of 26.  Is this a problem with just me, or have others experienced this issue?
Assuming it says there are 24/26 or 25/26, it just means somebody is taking a long time to connect. They are in the server so they take up the spot, but aren't loaded enough to be counted

I have actually seen the number go to 27/26, so something weird was going on. Right now, I am on the server with 3 people, and my Gmod reports 13 people in the game. I asked the other two players, and they said the same showed up for them.
Probably gash is making it so it shows more people so more will join

>> Probably gash is making it so it shows more people so more will join 
Nope.
This is getting to be a real problem, because even in the late night, people are being refused entry to the server even though there should be slots open.

Mario, try telling people, if they can't join the server, to try going to console. Then in console, type "connect 173.208.180.133:27015". <------ the ip is the Jailbreak server.
This method worked for me.
The problem seem to have resolved itself before the server crashed, we will see if it returns with the server.

>> Ben":29qfh2n7]Pharaoh is right. 
No, he's wrong.

It's a source engine bug from what I've read, and it's been affecting a lot of servers.
It's never full when I want to join.
